Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misinterpretation of an email exchange and not verified facts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the permit for the "March for Our Lives" rally was submitted several months before the school shooting, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that there was confusion between the "March for Our Lives" rally and a different event with a similar name.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the permit application for the rally was actually submitted one week after the school shooting.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on unreliable sources and not verifying the information before spreading it.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the timeline of the permit application, suggesting it was submitted several months before the shooting when it was actually submitted one week after.
